name: Q4T04
title: Aircraft Transition Training
objectives:
Objectives – Training focuses primarily on single-ship MOA operations, basic VFR enroute and pattern/approach procedures and basic IFR approach procedures to build the proficiency required to achieve milestones.
Accomplish the following:
Demonstrate the required proficiency level in all basic aircraft control, basic aircraft handling, instrument pattern and visual pattern operations, MOA maneuvers, and emergency procedures in preparation for initial solo, navigation sorties, basic formation and the qualification review (see “Milestone Criteria”).
Notes:
On Q4T01 and Q4T02 sorties, instructors enhance the student’s adaptation to the T-6A by carefully considering the student’s previous flying background when planning and executing mission profiles. Once a student is showing average progress on required maneuvers, introduce additional maneuvers to the profiles as necessary to facilitate individualized training and increase exposure to additional tasks and maneuvers.
On all sorties where increased G-loading is anticipated, adhere to the guidance under “Increased G Training” found in this chapter. If proficient, students may fly the aircraft during the G-Awareness Exercise.
Special Syllabus Requirements
Q4T01
1. Student demonstrates satisfactory knowledge of AGSM beforeflying Q4T01.
2. The student demonstrates proper transfer of aircraft control on the ground in the aircraft both with and without intercockpit communications.
3. The IP demonstrates control feel and aircrew confusion resulting from a dual control situation while on the ground in the chocksor other clear area.
Q4T02-05
1. Discuss High IOAT checklist / engine motoringprocedures.
2. Discuss local pattern breakout procedures from all patternpositions.
3. One pattern breakout in this unit must be from inside downwindand initiated after the landing gear isdown.
4. Complete a minimum of 1 go-around initiated prior to being established on final (restricted low approach). If able, offset during the go-around.
5. The IP demonstrates the stabilitydemonstration.
6. The student demonstrates proficiency in StabilityDemonstration. Q4T06+
1. The student demonstrates satisfactory knowledge of local area procedures, prominent landmark identification, local area hazards, and lost procedures.
2. All students demonstrate safe (“F”) OCF recoveryprocedures. Initiate recovery between 2 and 4 turns.
3. Student accomplishes a second transition-type solo during theQTXX element (after Q4TS1 is complete), or using an available Qual phase PR sortie or M40XX sortie
Prior to any Night Landings:
1. The instructor conducts a spatial disorientation demonstration.
2. Before first night sortie, the IP briefs the student on problems associated with night flying with particular emphasis on spatial disorientation.
